message.content:
cs.AI, cs.SI, cs.HC, cs.LG, cs.CL 

This paper describes a method for building affectively intelligent human-interactive agents using probabilistic and decision-theoretic models. The paper discusses the use of artificial intelligence in two different settings: an exam practice assistant and an assistive device for persons with a cognitive disability. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-categories for this paper are cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence) and cs.SI (Social and Information Networks). Additionally, the paper discusses human-computer interaction and the affective aspects of it, which makes cs.HC (Human-Computer Interaction) another likely sub-category. The paper also uses probabilistic models, which falls under cs.LG (Machine Learning) and cs.CL (Computation and Language).
